TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CompanionDeviceManager extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary:
System level service for managing companion devices
See this guide for a usage example.

remarks.para:
System level service for managing companion devices
See this guide for a usage example.

To obtain an instance call Context#getSystemService(Context#COMPANION_DEVICE_SERVICE) Then, call #associate(AssociationRequest, Callback, Handler) to initiate the flow of associating current package with a device selected by user.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

will be called once there's at least one device found for user to choose from
A handler to control which thread the callback will be delivered on, or null, to deliver it on main thread

Docs.param: id of the associated device.
Already connected stream of data incoming from remote associated device.
Already connected stream of data outgoing to remote associated device.
Docs.summary: Attach a bidirectional communication stream to be used as a transport channel for transporting system data between associated devices.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Content.IntentSender BuildAssociationCancellationIntent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Cancel the current association activity.
Docs.returns: An IntentSender that the app should use to launch in order to cancel the current association activity

remarks.para: Cancel the current association activity.
The app should launch the returned intentSender by calling Activity#startIntentSenderForResult(IntentSender, int, Intent, int, int, int) to cancel the current association activity
Calling this API requires a uses-feature PackageManager#FEATURE_COMPANION_DEVICE_SETUP declaration in the manifest
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Content.IntentSender BuildPermissionTransferUserConsentIntent(int32 associationId) cil managed

Docs.param: The unique AssociationInfo#getId ID assigned to the association of the companion device recorded by CompanionDeviceManager
Docs.summary: Build a permission sync user consent dialog.
Docs.returns: An IntentSender that the app should use to launch the UI for the user to confirm the system data transfer request.

remarks.para: Build a permission sync user consent dialog.

Only the companion app which owns the association can call this method. Otherwise a null IntentSender will be returned from this method and an error will be logged. The app should launch the Activity in the returned intentSenderIntentSender by calling Activity#startIntentSenderForResult(IntentSender, int, Intent, int, int, int).

The permission transfer doesn't happen immediately after the call or when the user consents. The app needs to call #attachSystemDataTransport(int, InputStream, OutputStream) to attach a transport channel and #startSystemDataTransfer(int, Executor, OutcomeReceiver) to trigger the system data transfer}.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DetachSystemDataTransport(int32 associationId) cil managed

Docs.param: id of the associated device.
Docs.summary: Detach the transport channel that's previously attached for the associated device.

remarks.para: Detach the transport channel that's previously attached for the associated device. The system will stop transferring any system data when this method is called.

Docs.param: id of the association to be removed.
Docs.summary: Remove an association.

Any privileges provided via being associated with a given device will be revoked

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Disassociate(string deviceMacAddress) cil managed

Docs.param: the MAC address of device to disassociate from this app. Device address is case-sensitive in API level < 33.
Docs.summary: Remove the association between this app and the device with the given mac address.

remarks.para: Remove the association between this app and the device with the given mac address.
Any privileges provided via being associated with a given device will be revoked
Consider doing so when the association is no longer relevant to avoid unnecessary battery and/or data drain resulting from special privileges that the association provides
Calling this API requires a uses-feature PackageManager#FEATURE_COMPANION_DEVICE_SETUP declaration in the manifest
This member is deprecated. use #disassociate(int)
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Extra field name for the AssociationInfo object, included into android.content.Intent which application receive in Activity#onActivityResult(int, int, Intent) after the application's AssociationRequest was successfully processed and an association was created.

Docs.summary:
A device, returned in the activity result of the IntentSender received in Callback#onDeviceFound Type is:
  • for classic Bluetooth - android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice
  • for Bluetooth LE - android.bluetooth.le.ScanResult
  • for WiFi - android.net.wifi.ScanResult

remarks.para:
A device, returned in the activity result of the IntentSender received in Callback#onDeviceFound Type is:
  • for classic Bluetooth - android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice
  • for Bluetooth LE - android.bluetooth.le.ScanResult
  • for WiFi - android.net.wifi.ScanResult
This member is deprecated. use AssociationInfo#getAssociatedDevice() instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RequestNotificationAccess(class Android.Content.ComponentName component) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: Request notification access for the given component.

remarks.para:
Request notification access for the given component.
The given component must follow the protocol specified in NotificationListenerService
Only components from the same ComponentName#getPackageName package as the calling app are allowed.
Your app must have an association with a device before calling this API
Calling this API requires a uses-feature PackageManager#FEATURE_COMPANION_DEVICE_SETUP declaration in the manifest

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void StartObservingDevicePresence(string deviceAddress) cil managed

Docs.param: a previously-associated companion device's address
Docs.summary: Register to receive callbacks whenever the associated device comes in and out of range.

remarks.para: Register to receive callbacks whenever the associated device comes in and out of range.
The provided device must be #associate associated with the calling app before calling this method.

Caller must implement a single CompanionDeviceService which will be bound to and receive callbacks to CompanionDeviceService#onDeviceAppeared and CompanionDeviceService#onDeviceDisappeared. The app doesn't need to remain running in order to receive its callbacks.
Calling app must declare uses-permission android.Manifest.permission#REQUEST_OBSERVE_COMPANION_DEVICE_PRESENCE.
Calling app must check for feature presence of PackageManager#FEATURE_COMPANION_DEVICE_SETUP before calling this API.
For Bluetooth LE devices, this is based on scanning for device with the given address. The system will scan for the device when Bluetooth is ON or Bluetooth scanning is ON.
For Bluetooth classic devices this is triggered when the device connects/disconnects. WiFi devices are not supported.

If a Bluetooth LE device wants to use a rotating mac address, it is recommended to use Resolvable Private Address, and ensure the device is bonded to the phone so that android OS is able to resolve the address.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public void StartSystemDataTransfer (int associationId, Java.Util.Concurrent.IExecutor executor, Android.OS.IOutcomeReceiver result);
.method public hidebysig instance void StartSystemDataTransfer(int32 associationId, class Java.Util.Concurrent.IExecutor executor, class Android.OS.IOutcomeReceiver result) cil managed
member this.StartSystemDataTransfer : int * Java.Util.Concurrent.IExecutor * Android.OS.IOutcomeReceiver -> unit

Docs.param: The unique AssociationInfo#getId ID assigned to the Association of the companion device recorded by CompanionDeviceManager
The executor which will be used to invoke the result callback.
The callback to notify the app of the result of the system data transfer.
Docs.summary: Start system data transfer which has been previously approved by the user.

remarks.para: Start system data transfer which has been previously approved by the user.

Before calling this method, the app needs to make sure #attachSystemDataTransport(int, InputStream, OutputStream) the transport channel is attached, and #buildPermissionTransferUserConsentIntent(int) the user consent dialog has prompted to the user. The transfer will fail if the transport channel is disconnected or #detachSystemDataTransport(int) detached during the transfer.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Unregister for receiving callbacks whenever the associated device comes in and out of range.

remarks.para:
Unregister for receiving callbacks whenever the associated device comes in and out of range.
The provided device must be #associate associated with the calling app before calling this method.
Calling app must declare uses-permission android.Manifest.permission#REQUEST_OBSERVE_COMPANION_DEVICE_PRESENCE.
Calling app must check for feature presence of PackageManager#FEATURE_COMPANION_DEVICE_SETUP before calling this API.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
